intro: Lobelia seguinii f. brevisepala, commonly known as the short-petioled lobelia, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and unique floral structures. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, with short, broad petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or limestone-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
